question: Some people think that in the modern world we are more dependent on each other. Others argue that people have become more independent. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
text: It is considered by some individuals that nowadays people more relay on one another while there are others who think the society has grown to get more autonomous. This essay will discuss these two distinct perspectives of this topic and provide my opinion that I firmly believe new technologies bring more opportunities to be independent.

It is evident to see that some people think the development of business and services which are provided into society makes people dependent on asking help from other specialists for service. When one buys some appliances or whatever a person experiences a need of understanding  how to exploit this equipment and then it might require an extra support by a specialist on a regular basis. For instance, if you acquire a car you will become dependent on a regular service to change engine oil at least.

From another point of view, the overwhelming progress in automatization makes humanity much more less dependent on each other. Having a personal car you are given a great variety of choices to travel to almost any place at your own pace. For example, I have taken a lot of different trips by my car to many regions of Russia spontaneously and independently from other people or public transportation.

In conclusion, even if some individuals argue that we become less autonomous due to having new services in our life, I consider that new technologies always bring the opportunities to make processes easier thereby more independent.

error_list.error_des: The indefinite article, an, may be redundant when used with the uncountable noun support in your sentence. Consider removing it.
The noun phrase engine oil seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
The double comparative more less may be repetitive. Consider changing this to the appropriate comparative form.
